address: Xã An Thạnh Đông, Huyện Cù Lao Dung, Tỉnh Sóc Trăng
thought:
**Analyzing and Mapping the Vietnamese Address**

Okay, so I'm presented with an old Vietnamese address and I need to figure out its current administrative unit. I'm starting with "Tỉnh Sóc Trăng". My first instinct is to check my province resolutions. Ah, here's Resolution 60-NQ/TW, point 19. It explicitly states that "Tỉnh Sóc Trăng" was merged into "Thành phố Cần Thơ". That's straightforward enough.

Now, for the ward. The address mentions "Xã An Thạnh Đông". I'll scan my other resolutions, specifically focusing on ward changes in the Cần Thơ area. Bingo! Resolution 1668/NQ-UBTVQH15 details a re-organization. Line 94 is key: it explicitly mentions that "Xã An Thạnh Đông" was merged, along with other wards, to form the new "Xã An Thạnh". This is exactly what I was looking for.

I'll check against my new ward data to confirm. The entry with the `ward_code` "31615" and `ward_name` "Xã An Thạnh", within "Thành phố Cần Thơ" perfectly aligns with my findings from the resolution. And since there's an explicit mention of the old ward's inclusion in the new one, I'd say the confidence level is pretty high.

So, the province name will be "Thành phố Cần Thơ", the ward name will be "Xã An Thạnh", and the ward code will be "31615". I can cite Resolution 1668/NQ-UBTVQH15, specifically point 94, as my source. I have high confidence in this result. Let me just double-check one more time, but I'm pretty confident in this mapping.

citation.header: 1668/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của thành phố Cần Thơ
citation.line: 94. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của thị trấn Cù Lao Dung và các xã An Thạnh 1, An Thạnh Tây, An Thạnh Đông thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã An Thạnh.
